required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Dermatological Assessment of Topical Use Product Through Dressings Predictive Studies for Evaluation of Photoirritation and Dermal Photosensitivity
clinical_study.official_title: Safety Dermatological Assessment of Topical Use Product Through Dressings Predictive Studies for Evaluation of Photoirritation and Dermal Photosensitivity

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to prove the product tested does not cause photoirritation or photosensitization reactions when exposed to sun light.

primary_outcome.measure: Photoirritation as measured through the use of dressings containing tested product and placebo
primary_outcome.description: The photoirritation will be measured with the use of four dressings that will be applied in the volunteer (3 dresssings containing different placebos and 1 containing the product). After some hours, the region is evaluated and radiated with UVA. That procedure occurs during the period of five days.

primary_outcome.measure: Photosensitization as measured through the use of dressings containing tested product and placebo
primary_outcome.description: The photosensitization will be measured with the use of four dressings that will be applied in the volunteer (3 dresssings containing different placebos and 1 containing the product). After some hours, the region is evaluated and radiated with UVA. That procedure occurs during the period of 32 days.

arm_group.description: This study is designed as a single group assignment, because the 4 dressings (3 placebos and 1 containing the product) will be applied in all volunteers. This means that the region in which the tested product will be applied will be compared with the other placebo regions in the same volunteer.

intervention.description: All the volunteers will receive the application of four dressings (3 placebos and 1 containing the tested product). After a certain period of time, photoirritation and photosensitization will be measured through the evaluation of tested region.
